Authors:
Paul A Smith, Matthias Lutz, Rebekka Ziegler, Marcin
Piatek
Title:
Anther smuts of Silene acaulis and S. uniflora in the Outer
Hebrides, including an assessment of ITS genotypes of Microbotryum
silenes-acaulis
Keywords:
arctic and alpine fungi, Basidiomycota, genotypes,
Microbotryum, molecular phylogenetics, plant pathogens
Abstract:
Anther smuts on Silene acaulis and S. uniflora from the
Outer Hebrides, Scotland, UK), are analysed using morphological and
molecular techniques, and found to represent Microbotryum
silenes-acaulis and M. silenes-inflatae, respectively. This is the first
identification of caryophyllaceous anther smuts in the Outer Hebrides
according to modern species concepts and the first report of
Microbotryum silenes-acaulis confirmed by molecular analysis from the
British Isles. Additionally, the genetic structure of Microbotryum
silenes-acaulis, based on all currently available ITS sequences, is
analysed and discussed. Seven ITS genotypes are determined for
Microbotryum silenes-acaulis, including three genotypes in North America
and four genotypes in Europe. Compared to European accessions, all North
American accessions share specific nucleotides and are genetically
divergent.
